This place is a stunner! While a basement unit, you rarely notice it with all of the thoughtful design details. Wide steps to the unit, full sized windows, lots of light and white. And the bathroom is crazy indulgent.
Not only is it great looking, they thought about almost everything for your stay. Forget a razor or toothbrush - got you covered. Need a snack or quick meal - got you covered. Need a cozy blanket - they got you.
The location is also great! While it is a bit of a drive to campus, you can easily walk to the waterfront, Church St. and north Burly.
The only things to be aware ofâ€¦my husband is 6â€™3â€ and the shower was a little short for him.
Iâ€™m 5â€™4â€ and our daughter 5â€™9â€ and we were fine.
If you are needing to use the couches as a foldout bed, they are a little firm, so again, something to be aware of. (The bed was super comfy).
This is a well curated, thoughtful, cozy location. I would not hesitate to stay here again.

review_text:
What can I say other than this stay was a 10/10. Abbott takes care of all of the details. His stay was beyond perfect. I could not have been more impressed with everything the stay had to offer. The bedroom and bathroom are cozy, clean, and well decorated. The bathroom was fully stocked with every possible essential you could need. Fresh coffee beans in the espresso machine paired nicely with the oatmilk in the fridge. The complimentary skincare products and Vermont made soaps/cheeses were welcome additions.
It felt like walking into your own home except it was a Airbnb stay. Could not recommend enough.
As a basement stay, your neighbors upstairs can be heard but its very faint. All in all MUST STAY IN BURLINGTON VERMONT.
The city is phenomenal as well, crunch/granola-y but fantastic food. Abbott recommended some great spots.

name: Elizabeth
rating_info:
Rating, 4 stars
,
Â·
November 2023
,
Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: Rolf's place is cozy and tidy and convenient to everything -- the Church St. marketplace, the waterfront and rail trail, Battery Park right across the street, etc. It's a little hard to find if you don't know the area well, because the name of the road changes from Battery St. to Park St. without enough signage to see it at night. We road around the block a couple of times until we figured it out. Once we did, we realized what a great location this is. Despite being in the thick of things, it's peaceful and quiet with strict quiet hours. The bedrooms are comfy and spacious, and the kitchen is well-stocked. The bathroom is tiny but the shower is nice and hot, and there's a tub if you have the time for a soak. The heat is easy to control and the wifi is super. Parking is easy as is access to the unit. Highly recommend for a quick getaway in BTV.

Â·
Stayed with kids
review_text: A very nice place to stay in Burlington--very comfortable and quiet for us and our little one. Very close to everything downtown and the lake. Had a small issue with the hot water going out briefly one morning, but help was sent very quickly--very responsive. As described, the slope up from the street and across the sidewalk to the otherwise flat driveway *will* bottom out your car, unless you have a pretty high suspension vehicle. (We scraped bottom each time going in and out with a Subaru Legacy, which I thought might be enough to clear it, but was not.) Having the gas station just 200 feet up the road was helpful for grabbing some quick provisions like milk and such. Would definitely look for this location again if returning to Burlington.

A Charming Getaway at Lisa's Cozy Tiny House
My recent stay at Lisa's delightful tiny house was a true escape into tranquility. From the moment I arrived, I was enveloped in a welcoming atmosphere that showcased Lisa's exceptional hospitality. The carefully curated decor and thoughtful amenities made the space feel like a home away from home. Despite our group's unique needs, Lisa's accommodating nature ensured we had everything we required for a comfortable stay.
The tiny house's location struck the perfect balance between serenity and accessibility, offering a peaceful retreat while still being conveniently located near local attractions. Lisa's attentiveness and willingness to cater to our needs made the experience all the more enjoyable. I'm truly grateful for the wonderful memories created during my stay. If you're seeking a charming and cozy getaway, I wholeheartedly recommend Lisa's tiny house â€“ a hidden treasure where comfort and hospitality seamlessly intertwine.

The place was small and adorable, exactly as advertised! The tiny home is located behind the main house with access to an outdoor shower, sauna, and a bathroom / shower within the main house. We felt we had our privacy, and it was nice to sleep so close to the outdoors.
The neighborhood is suburban but located very close to the bike trail and a short drive from Burlington proper. Our host was kind enough to lend us two bikes, and riding out to the causeway was a highlight of our stay. Other highlights included visiting the many nearby breweries - Foam, BBCO, Zero Gravity.
Perfect for a couple on a one or two night stay. Book according to the weather / season - there is a heater but no AC. They did provide a fan, but it can get muggy in the summer. Also, bring bug spray in the summer ğŸ˜Š

review_text: If you like very tiny houses, being close to the bike path and downtown, and relaxing in a quiet neighborhood then this spot is great! Consider it like glorified camping with a gorgeous bathroom and shower (across the lawn) and a very comfortable bed with soft linens. The bike path is 5 minutes away: it is about a 3 mile ride downtown or an 8 mile ride to the beautiful causeway. I was solo and the size of the place was perfect for me; it would be good for 2 people if they really dig each other. I was lucky to meet Trevor and Lisa who were both so welcoming, kind and positive. I will definitely be back if I need a spot in the area!

I love to walk around barefoot... and my feet stayed perfectly pink in this immaculate apartment. The "retro" look is completely charming, and feels as if your living in a time capsule. We only had one issue, which was figuring out the AC. Meghan responded right away, and it was really just a matter of pointing the remote properly. Wonderful spot and great, GREAT location. We parked our car in the designated spot and then walked everywhere for the next four days. Quiet at night, and the kitchen had everything we needed to cook dinners. I would definitely stay here again!

review_text:
My wife and I stayed in Meghan Jean's apartment for 3 nights in July 2023. We enjoyed our stay! She runs the business downstairs so I did pop in to say hello. It's especially nice in that it is walkable to most of the liveliest parts of Burlington; we arrived by car and literally did not move the car after parking it until checkout.
The only slight drawback I'd mention is that we were working 2 of the days that we were there and found that the WiFi could sometimes cut out for just long enough to interrupt videoconferencing. Not badly enough to make work impossible but it would be good to mention at the beginning of a meeting.
Noise sensitive people might notice that one can hear the Burlington Amtrak-train horn from the apartment pretty clearly as it goes through grade crossings, but there is only one of these trains per day in each direction (one morning, one evening). I think the Burlington Amtrak service is cool and was glad to hear it.
Would absolutely stay here again!

Â·
Stayed with kids
review_text: This place was really disappointing. The location was great and the decor was cute, but it needs a deep clean BADLY. Everywhere you look and touch, youâ€™ll find dirt and straight up grime. The walls, especially the bedroom. The outside of the kitchen trash can. Need a spoon? The drawers are gross when you open them up. The cabinets. Every single door. The mirror in the bathroom was dirty. The bench in the bedroom is stained. Every inch of molding is covered with dirt and dust. I tried to vacuum but the very vintage Bissell vacuum cleaner did more harm than good. Our socks were so gross after walking around without shoes on. The washer and dryer had so much lint and dirt and disgusting stuff on it it made me cringe to do a load of laundry. I think the vintage decor made it feel like it wasnâ€™t cleaned since the 70s. I seriously canâ€™t believe they have a cleaning fee. Meghan helped when she left us replacement hand soap and new shampoo and conditioner on the steps since the cleaning team forgot to restock. But she entered the apartment to restock the laundry detergent when we were gone and didnâ€™t ask us first and Iâ€™m not comfortable with that. I think this place was awesome at one time but it has been rented so many times and you can see and feel that. I read every single review before booking this place for my family and I regret spending so much money to have such a bad experience. I have spent way less and have had cleaner, better experiences. Donâ€™t waste your $500 with fees per night and stay around the corner in another Airbnb - UNLESS they paint and DEEP clean this place big time.

I would seek this place out for another trip to Burlington. Thanks!

Abbottâ€™s apartment is in a safe, central location that is in close proximity to all noteworthy areas in the city, such as Lake Champlain, parks, Church Street, and a variety of shops and restaurants. His apartment is stunning, extremely clean, and provides all of the luxurious comforts you could wish for when staying away from home.
Abbott is an exceptional host, and he truly goes above and beyond to make your stay as comfortable as possible. He is very kind, accessible, and knowledgeable of the area should you need recommendations. Where to even begin! First off I named this luxury basement apartment the â€œPerfect Snow Flakeâ€ for its elegant white beauty! There is so much to appreciate here- this private apartment is a destination of its own.
Every great review starts with honesty & I hate to write anything negative but here goes:
Location: I was a bit underwhelmed with Burlington itself- My boyfriend and I visited for just a few short nights and it seems as though this city has â€œfallen through the cracksâ€ if you will. I was surprised to see the amount of â€œstreet peopleâ€ that I did and from just 5 or 6 years ago I never remember this city being so bad. Every corner we walked was a bit â€œuneasyâ€ - but maybe this was just the time of year as it being warm. Aside from thatâ€” we did have boat plans that were canceled due to heavy rain so one of our main activities that I was looking forward to was canceled.
Restaurants & Activities: Church street has so many shops and restaurant- you can spend the day or spend the week and still explore a new little niche each day. The summer time has Lake Champlain boat tours & rides- with dock front restaurants and in the winter time the mountains are a short ride away for boarding and skiing. There is seriously so much to chose from.
Apartment: If we werenâ€™t staying in Abbotts amazing apartment overall our experience wouldâ€™ve been different, but despite our adventure plans being canceled due to rain, this space was comforting and everything you could want in an Airbnb! Thoughtful touches every step of the way- you really arenâ€™t missing anything- & if you are- the house has it! The rental space is truly perfect & did not disappoint- this stay made our three hour drive worth while! Thank you again!

name: Bill
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
Â·
September 2021
,
Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
Well what should I say about Abbott's place? I don't even know where to start. My wife and I enjoyed three nights there while relaxing to get away from some stressful work weeks, and to wander around Burlington a bit. It's perfectly located away from the chaos of church street, but close enough to walk to.
When you get inside, holy cow the attention to detail just comes out and hauls off and smacks you in the face. The place is new, fresh, and every single corner of it has been thought out. From the towel warmer in the bathroom, to the awesome shower to the soaking tub for two from heaven, and then there's that toilet seat, I won't go into details, but when you know you know :-)
The kitchen.. has more stuff in it than you could possibly need, and holy cow Abbott, the snacks! Organic, reasonably sourced everything at your fingertips. Drawers of goodies for you to cater to your late night cravings. the refrigerator was full of an array of seltzers, some eggs for breakfast, the freezer had multigrain bread for toast, and these amazing delicious ice cream bars. The pantry was stocked with various pastas and pasta sauces and grains and anything you would need to whip up a simple quick meal if you had forgotten to grab groceries or just needed a little something to eat at the end of the day. They had a French press there to enjoy coffee in the morning but I needed cream and sugar. I sent a message to Abbott and in a matter of minutes there was a freaking gift basket at the top of the stairs with oat milk, almond milk, soy milk, and a mason jar full of raw sugar. like I said. attention to detail. My wife needed to print a return slip for UPS, and boom it appeared at the top of our stairs with packing tape in tow. I'm telling you right now I stay almost exclusively in airbnbs everywhere I go and I have never had a more satisfactory experience anywhere I have ever stayed.
Just make sure you understand, this is in a basement of a little bungalow on a side street. When you come in you may say where am I staying? And then you get inside and you're like oh man this is my bomb shelter bunker from heaven.
Go here, no, actually don't go here, that way it's more available for me when I want to go back :-)

I also SO appreciated the thoughtfulness in noting where the furniture/wood was sourced, use of plant-based products, and eco-friendliness (accessible compost, recycle, and trash, as well as rags to use instead of paper towels). Nancy and her partner were also so friendly and accommodating, while also giving us plenty of privacy. 100% would stay here again when visiting Vermont. Thanks so much!

name: Christina
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
Â·
October 2022
,
Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
10/10 would recommend for anyone visiting Burlington --- even better if you're staying for more than one night :). The location is absolutely everything: it's a ~15-min walk to Church St., a ~5min walk or ~2min bike ride to the water/Burlington Greenway (miles and miles of bike trail along Lake Champlain) and the VIEW from the living room area of the apartment is breathtaking. I spent both mornings of my stay drinking coffee in one of the comfy lounge chairs, looking out over the water as the day began --- absolute bliss.
For bikers: I was able to bike all the way out to the Champlain Causeway, cross it, and come back almost without hitting roads from Nancy's place (Greenway --> a little neighborhood --> trail --> Causeway). It's a little over 20-miles door to door and was one of the most incredible experiences.
Nancy is so gracious and her apartment is fully outfitted with pretty much anything you'd need (and more than I needed for my brief stay!)-- I told her that she might need to kick me out! I appreciate the care that she's put into creating the lovey and functional space. The apartment shares an entrance with the "main" house where Nancy lives, but the living quarters are completely separate and I never felt as though I was infringing on her space. It's on a quiet street - which I really wanted - and also accessible by foot to everything downtown (if you're able to make that walk -- otherwise, it's an even quicker car ride!).
Maybe it's an 11/10 stay, after all :).
Stay here! You'll be charmed.

There is also no where on the property to dispose of our garbage which we found a little odd. Also an extra set of towels for the 3 nights wouldâ€™ve been appreciated. Parking is a little inconvenient as there were at least always 20 cars parked on the street (at least that was our case). Justin is a very responsive and friendly host which is always nice. I would give a 3.5 as 3 seems low but Iâ€™m not sure I would rate it a 4.

review_text: This is a great little space to stay! Justin is a very responsive host to answer any questions or give recommendations. The bed is super comfy and plenty of extra blankets and towels are provided. The bathroom is perfect size- not too big or small- and the water pressure in the shower is great. There is an adjustable thermostat in the room which works great and lets you get warm and cozy in the cold Vermont winter. The off street parking in the driveway is so easy and convenient. The television has Comcast, which is nice because you can watch the local news. The apartment is very well located- walking distance to a couple of corner stores and a market with everything you need. This Airbnb is also very very clean upon arrival- no dirt or dust anywhere, and really clean towels and blankets. I would definitely stay at Justin's place again and HIGHLY recommend it.

The room was really nice and well situated. The whole stay would have been perfect if it hadnâ€™t been for our rude awakening. We woke up to the sound of our car in the process of being towed. As we went to intercept them and pay the fine (50$), the agent in charge of towing told us that a man from the same address that we were staying at, called the towing company on us instead of coming to knock on our door (right next to them) and ask us to move it. Funnily enough the instructions on their reservation said that â€œon and off parking are availableâ€. We werenâ€™t blocking any driveways and made sure of it as we were parking. When I sent them a message, we were met with excuses. We did not know the Burlington parking laws and thatâ€™s on us, but the way they handled it was very far from the New England charm that we had been greeted with everywhere else.
If youâ€™re looking for a well situated room come here, just make sure that you come by foot or leave your car as far away as possible.

1. Confined, small space. Apt. is okay for one or two adults, not children or pets.
2. Kitchen actively discourages any cooking. No kitchen table or chairs.
3. Missing a toaster and an coffeemaker for coffee drinkers.
4. TV ROKU if you want to see standard TV programs you need to subscribe to a streaming service. Only thing available is CBS NEWS or old programs with multiple ads.
5. Very little air movement. Temperature and humidity eased somewhat by fan.
